meanings.definition: To poke or prod someone playfully.
meanings.sent1: She was goosing her friend to make her laugh.
meanings.sent2: The children were goosing each other during recess.
meanings.sent3: The siblings enjoyed goosing each other as a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's jokes were like goosing the audience into laughter.
meanings.sent5: The playful puppy kept goosing its owner for attention.

meanings.definition: To increase the speed of a vehicle suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The driver was goosing the accelerator to catch up with the speeding car.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally goosed the throttle, causing the car to lurch forward.
meanings.sent3: The race car driver was goosing the gas pedal to zoom past the competition.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gust of wind felt like goosing the car down the highway.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic warned against goosing the engine too hard to avoid damage.

meanings.definition: To add excitement or interest to something.
meanings.sent1: The magician was goosing up the crowd with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent2: The surprise twist at the end really goosed the plot of the movie.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected guest appearance goosed the excitement of the event.
meanings.sent4: The thrilling music score goosed the intensity of the movie scene.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk goosed the team's motivation before the big game.
